meanings.definition: To form into a frizz or curl.
meanings.sent1: She used a curling iron to friz her hair for the party.
meanings.sent2: The humidity caused her hair to friz up into tight curls.
meanings.sent3: The poodle's fur seemed to friz out in all directions after playing in the rain.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement made her heart friz with anticipation.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes friz the paint on the canvas, creating a unique texture.

meanings.sent1: Her natural hair had a beautiful friz that framed her face elegantly.
meanings.sent2: The stylist added some volume to her hair by creating a subtle friz at the ends.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's friz bounced playfully as she skipped down the street.
meanings.sent4: The friz of the waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The friz of the ribbon added a festive touch to the gift box.
